name: Topic
overview:
This class allows you interact with Google Cloud Pub/Sub.

First, install @google-cloud/pubsub with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/pubsub

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/pubsubâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var pubsub = require('@google-cloud/pubsub')();

Elsewhere

var pubsub = require('@google-cloud/pubsub')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/pubsub are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Topic
methods.description: A Topic object allows you to interact with a Google Cloud Pub/Sub topic.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete the topic. This will not delete subscriptions to this topic.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Get a topic if it exists.

You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is normally required for the create method must be contained within this object as well.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create the object if it does not exist. Default: false

methods.name: getMetadata
methods.description: Get the official representation of this topic from the API.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: iam
methods.description:
IAM (Identity and Access Management) allows you to set permissions on individual resources and offers a wider range of roles: editor, owner, publisher, subscriber, and viewer. This gives you greater flexibility and allows you to set more fine-grained access control.

The IAM access control features described in this document are Beta, including the API methods to get and set IAM policies, and to test IAM permissions. Google Cloud Pub/Sub's use of IAM features is not covered by any SLA or deprecation policy, and may be subject to backward-incompatible changes.

examples.caption: Get the IAM policy for your topic.

methods.name: getSubscriptions
methods.description:
Get a list of the subscriptions registered to this topic. You may optionally provide a query object as the first argument to customize the response.

Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error occurred or an array of pubsub/subscription objects.

examples.caption: Get the subscriptions for this topic as a readable object stream.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: options.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

methods.name: publish
methods.description: Publish the provided message or array of messages. On success, an array of messageIds is returned in the response.

examples.caption: The data property can be a JSON object as well.
You can publish a batch of messages at once by supplying an array.

params.name: message.attributes
params.description: • Key/value pair of attributes to apply to the message. All values must be strings.

exceptions.description: If a message is missing a data property.

methods.name: subscribe
methods.description:
Create a subscription to this topic. You may optionally provide an object to customize the subscription.

Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error occurred or a pubsub/subscription object.

params.name: options.ackDeadlineSeconds
params.description: • The maximum time after receiving a message that you must ack a message before it is redelivered.

params.name: options.autoAck
params.description: • Automatically acknowledge the message once it's pulled. (default: false)

params.name: options.encoding
params.description: • When pulling for messages, this type is used when converting a message's data to a string. (default: 'utf-8')

params.name: options.interval
params.description: • Interval in milliseconds to check for new messages. (default: 10)

params.name: options.reuseExisting
params.description: • If the subscription already exists, reuse it. The options of the existing subscription are not changed. If false, attempting to create a subscription that already exists will fail. (default: false)

params.name: options.timeout
params.description: • Set a maximum amount of time in milliseconds on an HTTP request to pull new messages to wait for a response before the connection is broken.

methods.name: subscription
methods.description: Create a Subscription object. This command by itself will not run any API requests. You will receive a pubsub/subscription object, which will allow you to interact with a subscription.

params.name: options.autoAck
params.description: • Automatically acknowledge the message once it's pulled.

params.name: options.interval
params.description: • Interval in milliseconds to check for new messages.

examples.code:
topic.iam.getPolicy(function(err, policy, apiResponse) {});

subscription.iam.getPolicy(function(err, policy, apiResponse) {});

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: policy.rules
params.description: • Rules to be applied to the policy.

params.name: policy.etag
params.description: • Etags are used to perform a read-modify-write.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: iam.testPermissions
methods.description:
Test a set of permissions for a resource.

Permissions with wildcards such as * or storage.* are not allowed.

examples.caption: Test a single permission.
Test several permissions at once.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.permissions
params.description: • A subset of permissions that the caller is allowed
